org.jamsim.ascape.weights

Interface WeightCalculator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ParameterSet
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CategoricalVarAdjustment, CategoricalVarWeightCalc, ContinuousVarAdjustment

    public interface WeightCalculator
extends ParameterSet
    An Observable ParameterSets that calculates a weight when provided with a variable map.
    Version:
    $Revision$
    Author:
    Oliver Mannion

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String WCALC_KEY
      Preference key used to store the last used weight calculator between runs.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addObserver(Observer o)
      Adds an observer to the set of observers for this object, provided that it is not the same as some observer already in the set.
      double[] getAllLevelProps()
      Return (in order) proportions for all levels.
      double getLevelWeight(Map<String,?> vars)
      Return the appropriate factor level weight based on the level value in vars.
      double getWeightBase()
      Return the base, or un-weighted, value of every agent.

      • WCALC_KEY

        static final String WCALC_KEY

    • Method Detail

      • getAllLevelProps

        double[] getAllLevelProps()
        Return (in order) proportions for all levels.
        Returns:
        proportions.

      • getLevelWeight

        double getLevelWeight(Map<String,?> vars)
        Return the appropriate factor level weight based on the level value in vars.
        Parameters:
        vars - map of variable names and values
        Returns:
        weight

      • getWeightBase

        double getWeightBase()
        Return the base, or un-weighted, value of every agent. This may be 1, if 1 agent corresponds to 1 member of the whole population. Or it may be greater than 1 if the number of agents are being scaled up to match a particular population size.
        Returns:
        weight equal

      • addObserver

        Adds an observer to the set of observers for this object, provided that it is not the same as some observer already in the set.
        Parameters:
        o - observer
